oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Original Jubilee Singers, Nashville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performing Identity
Musicians
Jubilee singers; African American singers; African American women singers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Even though it is titled "Original Jubliee Singers, Nashville, Tenn," this postcard includes only nine singers. A famous portrait created by Edmund Havell of the Jubilee Singers who performed for Queen Victoria in 1873 includes two additional singers.

The original Jubilee Singers included two students from Rutherford County,Tennessee: Maggie Porter (standing at center) and Thomas Rutling (standing in back with crossed arms). Left to right: Minnie Tate, Greene Evans, Isaac Dickerson, Jennie Jackson, Maggie Porter, Ella Sheppard, Thomas Rutling, Benjamin M. Holmes, and Eliza Walker.
